data.title: Administrative Services Bureau
data.meta_description: The Administrative Services Bureau includes Human Resources, Training, Accreditation, Public Information, Fleet, Fiscal Management, Investigations, Policy, Inmate Services, Classification, Alternative Programs, and PREA and ADA coordination.
data.text:
Undersheriff Robyn Nichols commands the Administrative Services Bureau with Captain Marybeth Plaskus serving as the Administrative Support Division Commander and Director Latanya Ervin overseeing the Inmate Services & Alternative Programs Division.

Administrative Support includes the Training & Accreditation Section, Human Resources Section, Public Information and Fleet/Uniform.

In addition to these divisions, the Administrative Services Bureau also includes the Investigations, Policy & Oversight Section and the Fiscal Management Section, which is responsible for development and management of the annual budget, purchasing, management of inmate accounts, federal and state reimbursement, and other fiscal responsibilities.

Administrative Services is also responsible for conducting all investigations of alleged staff misconduct. The internal affairs function helps uphold the Officeâ€™s high standards of integrity and dedication to duty, and involves the swift and effective investigation of all citizen complaints and allegations of improper action. This important responsibility is accomplished by our Internal Investigations Deputy under the supervision of the Investigations, Policy & Oversight Commander. Recent data on types and dispositions of investigations is available online .
